numbered_ace_sentences: 1. 50% of males text their parents at least once a week.
2. Around 70% of females text their parents at least once a week.
3. 30% of males call their parents at least once a week.
4. 55% of females call their parents at least once a week.
5. About 20% of males visit their parents at least once a week.
6. About 25% of females visit their parents at least once a week.
7. The percentage gap between males and females is smaller for visiting than for texting.
8. The percentage gap between males and females is larger for texting than for visiting.
9. I wonder why the gap decreases for in-person visiting.
10. I wonder why the gap increases for texting.
11. The graph shows different ways that people around my age engage with their family during weekly periods.
12. I can contact my parents in different ways.
13. The low percentage of males who contact their parents encourages me to contact my parents more.
14. The headline is: Keeping Ties Strong: Gender Trends in Weekly Parental Contact Across Communication Channels.
